messages.author: rileya
messages.text:
On 2013/10/24 19:55:07, DaleCurtis (OOO Oct 24-29) wrote:
> :* Is this standard syntax?

It's what cc_perftests' gyp file did, but perf_test.gyp only actually has one target, "perf_test", so I switched to that instead of the wildcard.

messages.author: DaleCurtis
messages.text: This can actually just be stack allocated.

messages.author: DaleCurtis
messages.text:
runs_per_sec.  Is 50000 enough to test this?  I originally used 50000, but later realized it was artificially slow due to the InputCallback used at the time (hence the NullInputProvider).

Is runs/sec the standard for perf tests?

messages.author: DaleCurtis
messages.text: Technically more than resampling.  "convert" should be fine.

messages.author: rileya
messages.text:
On 2013/10/24 19:55:07, DaleCurtis (OOO Oct 24-29) wrote:
> runs_per_sec.  Is 50000 enough to test this?  I originally used 50000, but later
> realized it was artificially slow due to the InputCallback used at the time
> (hence the NullInputProvider).
> 
> Is runs/sec the standard for perf tests?

I'll experiment a bit and see what is a more reasonable number (on my machine all 3 benchmarks take ~2s to run on a debug build, so it could probably be increased a fair bit).

runs/sec is what all of the cc_perftest tests use, so I followed along with that (and they use "runs/s" for the unit string).

messages.author: rileya
messages.text:
On 2013/10/24 19:55:07, DaleCurtis (OOO Oct 24-29) wrote:
> Technically more than resampling.  "convert" should be fine.
Sounds good, I applied your other naming suggestions as well.

message: Add comment indicating the end of the namespace
